snippet: Web sites, newspapers and other news organizations are gearing up to produce hours of video programming, in part to pursue the higher revenues available from video ads.
abstract: Web sites, newspapers and other news organizations are gearing up to produce hours of video programming, in part to pursue the higher revenues available from video ads; The Wall Street Journal already produces about four hours of live programming each weekday, with plans for more hours in 2012; The New York Times Web site has begun running a morning business newscast, which joins its taped daily show TimesCast.
lead_paragraph: Web sites, newspapers and other news organizations are gearing up to produce hours of video programming, in part to pursue the higher revenues available from video ads.

headline.seo: Print News Organizations Plunge Into Live Video
headline.main: Print News Media Go Live With Video Programming
headline.print_headline: Print News Media Go Live With Video Programming
